data.text: Standard Operating Procedure
MEHTSOP067 – Booking Process at Mid Essex Hospital Trust

table_items.text: Booking Process at Mid Essex Hospital Trust
Paula Ogutu, Kelly Buckley, John Cooil, Eileen Hatley, Rebecca Macklin, Dilshan Arawwawala.

Vanessa Evans-Green, Andrew Watson, Julia Bell, Megan Edwards, Kelly Lodge, Daniel Coleman, Karen Taberham, Paul Hawkins, Yasmin Khalil, Cheryl Snell, Janet Norton, Karen Cook, Caroline May, Carly Savage, Joanne Gilbey.

data.text: PURPOSE
The purpose of this Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) is to:
Align all outpatient bookings in accordance with trust policy
Outline the principles of booking outpatient appointments
Document the process for booking outpatient appointments
Provide a baseline for future process improvements
OVERVIEW

This document details the processes, owners and the timetable for dating new referrals to ensure patients are dated by clinical priority and in chronological order. If a patient is considered high priority or triaged as urgent these patients should be booked within 48 hours of receipt of referral where capacity allows.
Role – Administrative
Procedure – Outpatient Booking Process

table_items.text: New referral received into Trust via paper
New Referral received into e-RS via Gp
Paper Referral logged in Lorenzo by MERC
Clinical Team to Triage and Grade referrals in Lorenzo
Clinical Team to triage via e-RS if electronic either in Referrals for Review or from ASI List
Once patients are triaged in Lorenzo they are transferred onto an Access Plan for dating
Triaged as urgent patients dated within 4-6 weeks of receipt of referral (given capacity is available)
Patients triaged as routine aim to be dated between 6-10 weeks of receipt of referral (given capacity is available)
Patients to be dated in clinical priority and chronological order from RTT PTL report available on the suite of OP Reports
Where capacity does not allow booking within the required timeframe please see Appendix 1
No response in 24hr timeframe from SM escalate to service ADO
Reviewed weekly by Outpatient ASM's SM & ADO for backlog clearance plans and discussed at weekly Outpatient meetings
Backlog reviewed at Elective Care Group Weekly
Escalation of undated patients as below ; 1) Team Leads RBMS 2) Service Managers 3) ADO 4) CD's 5) Exec Team
RBMS Hub staff RBMS Team Leaders RBMS Team Leaders Service managers ADO
Cancer Two Week Waits All TWW referrals must be booked
within 7 days. Escalation to service Managers t to book to 14 days Escalation to ADO to book > 14 days

Specific actions related to patients requesting to book over 52 weeks Work within access policy Patients who request to book outside of 40 weeks following previous cancellation/s by the patient should be advised that no further appointment can be made until there has been a Consultant review. RBMS/Booking teams to forward to Consultant cc Service manager Out-patient Booking
RBMS MSK SILO Booking Teams RBMS MSK SILO Booking Teams RBMS RBMS RBMS Services
TWW referrals not on Somerset TWW referral ASI's ASI report Referrals not yet triaged

data.text: Appendix 1
RBMS Actions Prior to Escalation to Service Cardiology
Use Rapid Access Chest Pain Clinic Slots if not filled 24hrs prior
If patients are over 30weeks for first OPA ensure the shortest waiting patients that are non-urgent are swapped (DW SM if concerned)
DERMATOLOGY
When Cancer referrals are over weekly Fast Track slots the first escalation to the coordinator/SM to find additional sessions
If No additional sessions can be sought then shortest waiting non urgent routine patients are moved to accommodate RBMS
Routine patients are then displaced till they get to 40weeks, further discussion with service manager is required
Any Routine patient having their appointment moved for the second time needs to be escalated to the SM
Daily discussion to be had between SM/ Derm Hub and Coordinator when referrals are over the 128 FT allocated slots.
RBMS Actions Prior to Escalation to Service
RBMS Actions Prior to Escalation to Service MSK
NEWS
Phone patients to see if will go to another site (ie. St Peters, BCH)
Swap patient out (patient dated in shorter wait time)
Convert 2 f/u for 1 new (by consultant consent)
FOLLW UPS
Over book clinic by Consultant consent.
Care of the Elderly
Ensure all slots are filled, Any F:U slots are turned into NEW slots
(2f:U =1 new) RBMS
Ensure there are No HOT SLOTS RBMS
Move routine non urgent cases to accommodate FT referrals
Escalate to ASM/SM if an ad hoc is required if all previous steps have not addressed demand.
Breast, Vascular and Urology
The following points below, is guidance for the outpatient team with regards to booking and utilising all appointment slots.
All clinics are required to be booked at 6 weeks. At this time the only clinic slots available should be 2WW and MDT follow up slots.
Any capacity remaining or a patient cancels etc the following actions are required prior to escalation to the service –
MDT & 2WW Slots–
If not all MDT follow up slots have been used after MDT. The MDTC and outpatients HUB are to communicate in using these slots for 2WW patients.
1 MDT follow up slot is the equivalent for 2 new 2WW patients. These are to be used for patients breaching or bringing forward.

If 2WW and MDT follow up slots have been all booked into and there is still capacity remaining, please contact patients and bring forward to reduce 2ww target to 7 days If patients decline this then to use the slots for RTT patients, stating long waiters down and in urgency.
RTT slots –
RTT appointment slots should always be booked longest waiter down and in urgency as per policy.
ASIs and overdue follow ups to be booked if capacity after long waiters and clinically urgent have been dated
Both RTT and cancer slots can be converted as long as there is enough time allocated for the type of slot the patient requires.
Any patient under 52 weeks are not to have an appointment booked past 52+ weeks unless an appropriate clock stop has been applied i.e surveillance patients.
Colorectal, General Surgery,UGI & Paediatric Surgery
All clinics are required to be booked at 6 weeks. At this time the only clinic slots available should be 2WW and MDT follow up slots.
9 clinics have already been identified for overbooking and this is currently in templates.
Any capacity remaining or a patient cancels etc the following actions are required prior to escalation to the service –
MDT & 2WW Slots–
If not all MDT follow up slots have been used after MDT. The MDTC and outpatients HUB are to communicate in using these slots for 2WW patients.
1 MDT follow up slot is the equivalent for 2 new 2WW patients. These are to be used for patients breaching or bringing forward.
If 2WW and MDT follow up slots have been all booked into and there is still capacity remaining. Either –
Ensuring 2WW patients have been called to bring forward to reduce the 2WW target to 7 days. If patients decline this then to use the slots for RTT patients, stating long waiters down and in urgency.
RTT slots –
RTT appointment slots should always be booked longest waiter down and in urgency as per policy.
If there is still capacity we should be looking to book down to the following weeks per speciality.
General Surgery – 25 weeks
Paediatric Surgery – 25 weeks
Colorectal Surgery – 30 weeks
Upper GI Surgery – 30 weeks
If all patients have been through down to the number of weeks above, it is to look at ASI list and overdue follow ups.
For both RTT and cancer slots can be converted as long as there is enough time allocated for the type of slot the patient requires.
Any patient under 52 weeks is not to have an appointment booked past 52+ weeks. The only consultants that booking pass 52+ weeks will happen with are Mr Siddiqi (LGI) and Sri K
(UGI).
Reg clinics are to be booked as templated. If the reg clinic is alongside a consultant clinic and there is free capacity. Discussion with the service regarding converting slots appropriately.
Respiratory, Allergy, Neurology Respiratory
Cancer patients not booked by RBMS, tends to be from MDT
Shortest waiting non urgent routine patients are moved to accommodate more urgent RBMS
Routine patients are then displaced till they get to 40weeks, further discussion with service manager is required
Any Routine patient having their appointment moved for the second time needs to be escalated to the SM
Allergy
Currently booking first appt to circa 40 weeks,
If a ‘long waiter' patient cancels their appointment displace routine patient with shorter wait
If a ‘long waiter' patient cancels their appointment and it cannot be rescheduled before breech date escalate to SM
Neurology
For urgent patient displace shorter wait non-urgent
If a ‘long waiter' patient cancels their appointment displace routine patient with shorter wait

If there is an empty FU slot it can be converted to a new slot (NB if a consultant is seeing a FU from a previous locum this will need to be booked as a new pt. for that consultant) – no more than x1 converted slot per clinic
If a ‘long waiter' patient cancels their appointment and it cannot be rescheduled before breech date escalate to SM
Gynaecology
- Bookings team to follow current SOP process of booking new patients in date order and follow ups from top down of PTL.
- Bookings up to 6 weeks in the future can be made. Bookings further to this date if required can be given with Service Manager / Assistant Service Manager permission.
- Lack of 2ww capacity to be escalated to the following agreed distribution list to ensure capacity carved out (booking team not to book into any slot as clinic must meet certain criteria):

- RTT or urgent capacity can be made by the bookings team by cancelling ‘Routine' ‘New' patients booked under 8 weeks that have not previously been cancelled. Bookings team do not need service permission for this.
- If a new or follow up slot remain empty 48 hours prior to clinic, the slot can be used for the alternative appointment without service permission.
- Oncology Follow Up access plan list takes priority over Mr Partington routine/RTT access plan.
- ASI's will continually be triaged and reviewed by service and feedback made to Bookings team if can be booked in alternative clinics.
Head & Neck
The following points below, is guidance for the outpatient team with regards to booking and utilising all appointment slots.
All clinics are required to be booked at 6 weeks. At this time the only clinic slots available should be 2WW and MDT follow up slots.
Any capacity remaining or a patient cancels etc. the following actions are required prior to escalation to the service –
MDT & 2WW Slots–
If not all MDT follow up slots have been used after MDT. The MDTC and outpatients HUB are to communicate in using these slots for 2WW patients.
MDT follow up time slot must equal the equivalent for the new 2WW patients. These are to be used for patients breaching or patients being brought forward.
If 2WW and MDT follow up slots have been all booked into and there is still capacity remaining. Either –
Ensuring 2WW patients have been called to bring forward to reduce the 2WW target to 7 days. If patients decline this then to use the slots for RTT patients, starting long waiters down and in urgency.
RTT slots –
RTT appointment slots should always be booked longest waiter down and in urgency as per policy.
If there is still capacity we should be looking to book down to the following weeks per speciality.
ENT Adults – 30 weeks
ENT Paeds – 25 weeks
Oral – 30 weeks
Max Fax – 30 weeks
Orthodontic – 20 weeks
If all patients have been through down to the number of weeks above, please look at ASI list and overdue follow ups.
For both RTT and cancer slots can be converted as long as there is enough time allocated for the type of slot the patient requires.
Any RTT patient under 30 weeks on a routine pathway can be moved to accommodate 2WW or long waiters if dated out of turn.
Any patient under 52 weeks is not to have an appointment booked past 52+ weeks.

Reg clinics are to be booked as templated. If the reg clinic is alongside a consultant clinic and there is free capacity, discuss with the service regarding converting slots appropriately. Only appropriate patients can be placed in non-consultant clinics, i.e. not new patients or 2WW if this is not on the template. However swaps can be made from consultant clinics to allow appropriate appointment types to be dated. For example move follows ups to non- consultant clinics and place news into consultant clinic.
Plastics Surgery/Burns
All follow up appointments are booked within 48 hours of clinic appointment.
Clinics are required to be booked at 6 weeks. At this time the only slots available should be urgent. This excludes Trauma and Cancer clinics.
RTT
If slots available, bring Patients forward.
RTT appointment slots should always be booked longest waiter down and urgent as per the Patient Access Policy
Overdue follow-ups to be booked if capacity after long waiters and clinically urgent have been dated
Both RTT and Cancer slots can be converted as long as there is enough time allocated for the type of slot the Patient requires.
Any Patient under 52 weeks are NOT to have an appointment booked past 52+ weeks unless an appropriate clock stop has been applied.
When additional capacity required, Clinicians/ASM's/SM's are to be advised.
Ensure all slots are filled. Any follow ups should be converted into new slots and vice versa.
Clinics can only be overbooked with Clinician consent.
CANCER
When cancer referrals are over capacity, escalate to ASM/SM/ADO.
Gastroenterology
Cancer patients not booked by RBMS are from MDT
Shortest waiting non urgent routine patients are moved to accommodate more urgent RBMS
Routine patients are then displaced till they get to 40weeks, further discussion with service manager is required
Any Routine patient having their appointment moved for the second time needs to be escalated to the SM
Currently booking first appt to circa 40 weeks,
If a ‘long waiter' patient cancels their appointment displace routine patient with shorter wait
If a ‘long waiter' patient cancels their appointment and it cannot be rescheduled before breech date escalate to SM
For urgent patient displace shorter wait non-urgent
If a ‘long waiter' patient cancels their appointment displace routine patient with shorter wait

If there is an empty FU slot it can be converted to a new slot (NB if a consultant is seeing a FU from a previous locum this will need to be booked as a new pt for that consultant) – no more than x 2 converted slot per clinic
If a ‘long waiter' patient cancels their appointment and it cannot be rescheduled before breech date escalate to SM
Stroke / TIA
Shortest waiting non urgent routine patients are moved to accommodate more urgent RBMS
Routine patients are then displaced till they get to 40weeks, further discussion with service manager is required
Any Routine patient having their appointment moved for the second time needs to be escalated to the SM
Currently booking first appt to circa 40 weeks,
If a ‘long waiter' patient cancels their appointment displace routine patient with shorter wait
If a ‘long waiter' patient cancels their appointment and it cannot be rescheduled before breech date escalate to SM
For urgent patient displace shorter wait non-urgent
If a ‘long waiter' patient cancels their appointment displace routine patient with shorter wait

If there is an empty FU slot it can be converted to a new slot (NB if a consultant is seeing a FU from a previous locum this will need to be booked as a new pt for that consultant) – no more than x 2 converted slot per clinic
If a ‘long waiter' patient cancels their appointment and it cannot be rescheduled before breech date escalate to SM
Oncology
MDT
Oncology New slots are for MDT patients only (or GP/tertiary ref at clinician's discretion)
All MDT requests are to be dealt with as priority
Book as per requestor's advice
If no capacity to book to the requested date:
– If x2 follow up slots available – book and merge the two slots
– Book to next available within 1 week
– If no capacity for the following week Escalate to Service Manager
On Treatment Patients – (chemotherapy)
All requests that are clinically urgent are to be dealt with as priority
Book as per requestor's advice
If no capacity to book to that date:
– Overbook clinic with comments that chemotherapy have requested to book
– Routine chemotherapy follow-up: Book to next available within 1 week
– If no capacity for the following week escalate to Oncology Secretary to discuss with consultant of where best to place the patient. NB: Contact SM if unable to contact consultant.
Routine Follow-Up from Access Plans
If clinics are fully booked:
Generate a list of patients (only if there is no clinic capacity)
Escalate to the Service Manager with the list – ad hoc clinics would need to be considered
Nephrology
Shortest waiting non urgent routine patients are moved to accommodate more urgent RBMS
Routine patients are then displaced till they get to 40weeks, further discussion with service manager is required
Any Routine patient having their appointment moved for the second time needs to be escalated to the SM
Currently booking first appt to circa 40 weeks,
If a ‘long waiter' patient cancels their appointment displace routine patient with shorter wait
If a ‘long waiter' patient cancels their appointment and it cannot be rescheduled before breech date escalate to SM
For urgent patient displace shorter wait non-urgent
If a ‘long waiter' patient cancels their appointment displace routine patient with shorter wait

If there is an empty FU slot it can be converted to a new slot (NB if a consultant is seeing a FU from a previous locum this will need to be booked as a new pt for that consultant) – no more than x 2 converted slot per clinic
If a ‘long waiter' patient cancels their appointment and it cannot be rescheduled before breech date escalate to SM
